description:
A poem on the box describes the game: "A Thoughtful Girl must dress with care. / What goes with what?  What shall you wear? / The spinner says to pick some shoes. / But only YOU know which you'll choose. / And with your clothing you'll select / the hobby that you most respect. / Pursue your vision with a passion-- / There's more to life than only fashion! / The first one dressed and on her way / has won the game. / Do you want to play?"

Each player chooses a paper doll and take turns spinning the spinner.  The spinner will tell them which piece of clothing or accessory to add to their doll.  One space on the spinner requires the spinner to lose a piece.  The first player to completely dress and equip his or her doll wins.

The game is notable for its diverse paper doll characters, multi-ethnic outfits and selection of hobbies that is less stereotypically girly, such as astronomy, guitar and science.

Spin Doctor: The Card game of Dirty Politics is a card game for 2 to 6 (or more) players wherein the players take on the role of candidates running for President of the United States. During the course of the game, players will accumulate votes by collecting state cards while at the same time thwarting their opponent’s ability to do the same by putting them in scandal, winning debates, being underhanded and generally behaving like a mud slinging politician!

In Adventure Land, King Agamis rules from his castle. Rich cities, vast forests and rugged mountain ranges dominate the country. The large river is known to be lined with gold and the forests filled with medicinal herbs, but dangers lurk beneath the fog! Only the bravest adventurers dare to face the challenges. When you move your adventurer tactically and bravely fight the fog creatures, you'll win the favor of the king. Illustrated by Franz Vohwinkel and designed by acclaimed duo Wolfgang Kramer and Michael Kiesling who between them have won the highly coveted Spiel des Jahres award 5 times.

—description from the publisher

There are three different adventure scenarios to choose from, depending on the age/skill of the players: 

    Adventure 1 (The Fellowship ) the simplest of the three adventures
    Adventure 2 (The Magnificent) a little more challenging
    Adventure 3 (Escape to the Cities) the most challenging because there are many things to pay attention to simultaneously

In What Do You See? Colors, players choose face-down cards, trying to be the first to complete a set and win the game. There are three different ways to play.


     Search and Match Colors - Each player takes a card marked with a colored star designating which color he or she will collect. Picture cards are placed face-up in the center of the table. Each player in turn takes a card to match their color. If the color matches, the player keeps the card. If not, he or she must put it back. Play continues until all players have six matched color cards. This game is for very young players, and is meant to teach color recognition.



     Seven That Match - This game is played similarly to Search and Match Colors. In this version, each player has two color cards to match. Cards are placed face down. Players pick one card at a time and try to match it to one of their cards. If it matches, the player keeps the card. If not, it goes back to the center face down. The first player to collect six cards matching the color of one of his or her star cards wins.



     What Color Do You See? - In this version, each player has a game board with spaces for eight different colors. All cards are placed face-down on the table. Players take turns choosing a face-down card. If the player doesn't yet have the color, he or she covers the corresponding space on his or her card. If he or she does have the color, the card goes back face down. In this version, there are also wild cards, which can be placed on any color. The first player to cover all colors on the card wins the game.

The lonely dweller of the lighthouse was sailing back to his lookout packed with food when a huge, all-consuming storm started. The raging waves consumed the ship and its load, too. Luckily, he escaped and pulled through the storm on a lonely rock. Four sailboats set out after him competing with each other to hurry to his aid.

There is six wind strength discs (which mark the steps), that lay face down at one end of the board. First player turns over any of the wind strength discs and takes as many steps as shown on the disc. After everyone has looked at the disc, he turns it back over immediately. There is two rules:

     The total number of steps on the disc have to be taken.
     You can step forwards or backwards, but only in one direction at a time, you can’t change direction while in motion!


If somebody steps on the field where the guard of the lighthouse got shipwrecked, he has to place guard in the boat and continue the trip with him (since the aim is to reach the goal together with him)! If player placed him in the boat, he has to mix the wind strength discs at once, before the next player’s turn. This makes the game harder, since the discs memorized so far change their places. The goal is still to arrive on the field where the guard or the ship transporting the guard is standing. According to some rules, the guard can change the boat.

The player who first docks at the isle of the lighthouse with the guard sitting in his or her boat, wins.

Trick-taking game based on characters from the comic series Fried Pickle Noir by J.R. Mounts.  Players assemble teams to take on jobs in the crime-ridden city of The Pits.  The goal is control the teams and win the jobs by selecting the right Good Guys, Mobsters, or Shady Characters to send in.  Shady Characters can count as both Good Guys or Mobsters, and each one adds their own twist to the game!

Ghoulball is a fast-moving card game based on the favorite sport of the monstrous citizens of Moonrise, from the comic series Scairy Tales by J.R. Mounts.

Ghoulball combines quirky characters and CCG-like battle mechanics into a crazy sports simulation played from a shared deck. Players take on the role of team managers and coaches, recruiting players, setting strategies, and attempting to score more goals than their opponents.  The real fun begins when the Ghoulballs themselves come alive and impact the game in surprising ways!

More about the game and the world of Scairy Tales can be found at The Ghoulball Clubhouse and scairytalesnoir.com.

Street Race -boardgame is a game for car enthusiast. The Main goal of the game is to become "The Car King".

Game features:


     Hot Rod City which has 44 different places/functions (for example garage, casino, court house, traffic lights, police station, chip tuning, car repair, speed camera, slippery road, hot rod shop, used car shop, classic car shop, sports car shop, restaurant, speed pumps (50 different cards) and so on.
     Race track for track - and pinks slips race (money or car as a bet)
     Buy and sell cars (30 different carcards) and race against other players
     Put pedal to the metal on track, but in the city watch out for the moving police unit and speed camera (or you will get the speeding ticket, 50 different tickets)
     Lots of playing money
     And many more


Game is a combination of luck and tactics!

Different playing modes:

     The Car King (winner is who buys first one sport car (easy) or winner is who buys first two sport cars(harder)).
     Elimination mode also possible

Valence is a fun card game that uses simple math, colors, and cartoon ninjas to teach kids (8+) chemistry!  Players use more than 25 different molecules to interact with each other and win the game!

Players draw Element cards from the deck in order to form Molecules. Each Element has a different Valence number that describes how many electrons it has to give (positive) or how many electrons it needs (negative) to have a full valence shell. If the Valence numbers add up to zero, they form a Molecule!

Each Molecule is worth a certain point value. If your molecules add up to 10 points then you win the game! But beware… several molecules are vulnerable to attack from your opponents! Acids attack Bases (4 points) and turn them into Salt and Water (1 point each). Deadly Carbonyls (which have the special power of removing oxygen from the board) are vulnerable to attack by Water. Players interact with each other using real chemical reactions!

In Cinema Frontier, players should combine cards in the most efficient way to create the best possible movie.

"Scene" cards and "actor" cards are distributed with each player on a turn either adding a card to a pile or claiming a pile, and once all players have claimed a pile, they need to shoot the scenes, preferably with the actors they have. The last player to pick a pile must draw an accident (event), but will also be first player next round.

The actors' special skills spice things up as they allow the players to do various tricks to improve their situation. Points are awarded each time a scene is finished, with a bonus at the end for linking certain scenes together and having a varied movie. Most points at the end wins.

Description from the publisher:

Who's feeling brave and wants to go on an exciting adventure? Then fly into the air and set a course for the 13 islands!

In Der Schatz der 13 Inseln, the airship must first travel to cliffs and volcanoes, then make its way through the dense fog. Part of the game is to collect rare artifacts and mysterious objects on the island. That's how a group of researchers will impart their important clues to help find the legendary treasure. But time is running out! Because other pilots have also been searching for the treasure. Who will be the first to unravel the mystery of the 13 islands and earn the legendary treasure?

Description from the publisher:

Honorable Sultan Semih wishes to reward his most able counselors with gold from the royal coffers. The Sultan has ordered amazing rare objects — a silver column, a flying carpet, a magic lamp, and more — to be carefully stacked upon a magical silver column.

In a thrilling contest in Schnapp die Schätze, players vie for the magical silver column. Only the one who fortune shines upon most — granting him speed, agility and luck — will earn his weight in gold and the title of Grand Counselor. A breath-taking, fast-reaction game.

Description from the publisher:

Every year on witching night, a great magic potion brewing competition takes place. All young sorcerers have to gather everything together for their magical recipes. Who can brew their potions the fastest in the fast-paced reaction game Kesselchaos? And also make sure all the ingredients are right? Watch out because the Senior Sorcerer Yorandel will check all of the potion cauldrons at the end.

Description from the publisher:

Every day, Mailman Marty has loads of packages to deliver. Sometimes he's not very careful and he makes a mistake. Luckily, Marty has helpful children to make sure all the packages arrive at the right address.

In Die Post ist da, the children need to look very closely in order to recognize the colors and objects, matching them correctly. Each turn, a player receives a package card. He has to select a room to deliver the package to (the correct room is the one with the matching colour). After the player has delivered the package, he can verify if he has selected the correct room by flipping the card: on the back is a picture of an object - if that object is also depicted in the room, the package has been correctly delivered.

The game ends in a (shared) victory when all packages have been delivered.

Legends of Draxia is a fantasy strategy card game that utilizes resource management to kill monsters, make buildings, and cast spells.

Players will pull 3 random cards from the character deck, each with a secret end-game bonus, and choose one, discarding the others. Players take turns pulling two resource cards from the main deck into their hand. Based on what resources they have in their hand and from any buildings they have built, players can buy spells, construct buildings, or fight monsters. Resources must be wisely spent while not exposing the player's secret end-game bonus.

Game ends after all cathedral buildings are constructed or monster deck is exhausted. Players tally points for the buildings they constructed and monsters they have destroyed, along with the end-game character bonus. Player with the highest points wins.

Description from the publisher:

In Mad Libs: The Game, players use the word-filled game cards in their hand combined with the sentence card in play to make the most appropriately inappropriate sentences possible. The funniest sentence by popular vote wins the round, and the first player to win three rounds wins the game.

About the gameHOPE: Heroes of Postapocalyptic Earth represents a card game full of conquests, battles, strategies and survival based on post-apocalyptic vision of the near future, which is designed by Czech gaming and graphic company HOPE Studio.

Core game of HOPE contains everything you need for 2 players and provides a fresh start for new players and experienced players alike. A unique concept ensures high replayability thanks to the variety of cards and the different play of dissimilar types of races. What tactics you choose is entirely up to you.

Each player represents one of the four surviving races, which are skirmishing for a control over the rest of the sources needed to survive on the unhospitable planet Earth. Combat like a leader of Mutants who try to infect their neighborhood with radioactivity. Be side by side of frightening Aliens who desire for blood and fast occupation of enemy territory. Bots got the dynamic artificial intelligence and represent a threat to enemies with deadly weapons and huge level of defense. And Humans? Will they successfully survive with your help another terrifying night in a shelter?

Conquer the collapsing world by gaining sources, winning battles against opponent’s units and finally controlling over sections of the battleground. Combat for dear life is just beginning!

For more info visit

     Websites
     Facebook
     Google+
     Instagram.


				
				
					4 deadly racesIn the HOPE Cardgame you can find one of the four deadly races or create your own deck.

				
				
					AliensAliens are bloodthirsty race, which represents the scariest dreams and nightmares of people. They come from the deepest underground, from which climbed due indelible traces of fear and hopelessness of humans, who lived through the agony during the World War III. In recent years, Aliens are making heartless attacks for food and attack fortresses of people in subway and in ruins of towns and cities. They don’t know a fair fight, they attack in groups and don’t leave any witnesses. Create a band of many Aliens and feed them with fresh meat!

				
				
					MutantsRadiation disease or adapted to existing conditions, as well as posthumous form of living. This would simply introduce representatives of Mutants. There are many kinds of them. While animal species are wild and incontrollable, there are an intelligent sort of Mutants, which leads the wild Mutants for one purpose: to infect other living creatures to join their company. Stand on the side of Mutants and infects all who breathe clean air!

				
				
					BotsDuring the World War III, people experimented with dynamic artificial intelligence. The result was the emergence of the first robots with fully dynamic AI, but, as it turned out, was a huge mistake. Thanks to dynamic AI robots able to live its own life and began to desire to annihilation of their creators. "Bots", as they were called in short, occupy most of factories and abandoned industrial zones. Bots are great specialists in the fight against superiority of opponents, because of their defensive abilities and are equipped with destructive weapons. Lead Bots and smash all enemies in the dust!

				
				
					HumansHumans represent apparently the weakest race, but they profit from the knowledge of terrain and cities. During and after the World War III, Humans had to hide in underground fallout shelters and subway stations. Larger groups defend desperately every meter of underground basis, which are still declining. Others often set off on the surface and looking for usable supplies and everything that could be used to increase their chances to survive. There are also loners who wander the devastated country and combat face to face with their opponents. Connect to people who struggle to survive and use their greatest strength – the fight from a distance!

				
				
					Short characteristic
     The game combines card and board game.
     Recommended player’s age 14+.
     Playing time 15-30 minutes.
     The game is completely in English.
     3 types of cards – Units, Locations and Events.
     4 types of races – Aliens, Bots, Humans and Mutants, that can be played separately or creating own decks.
     3 game modes – Classic game, Artifact game and Two on two variant.
     Each round is divided into six phases – Playing Units, Moving Units on the Game board, Survey the terrain, Battle, Dominance on the    battleground and Drawing cards.
     Regularly issued expansions cards, called "Survival packs".

In Draw 4: Dig for Dinos, you are a paleontologist digging through the dirt on an expedition to complete your dinosaur bone collection! Players try to collect complete sets of dinosaur bones by taking turns picking either an Action Tile or Dinosaur Tile from the grid, while collecting cards may be limited by their location or by another player's actions! Expose and collect the most dinosaur bones and become a world-renowned paleontologist!

Description from the publisher:

Yiiiiippy! In toy wonderland, the mischievous little kobolds swipe everything in their reach. Who wants to join them by collecting toys in different shapes and colors? But not so fast! You have to pay close attention and be able to "see" with your hands because the toys could be hidden in the bag or the kobold cave.

Whoever is the fastest to collect four different shaped toys and colors in Silly Shenanigans wins this crazy toy hunt and is crowned the "Lord of all the Kobolds".

Description from the publisher:

The final frontier of space...and in the middle of it brave pilots are exploring distance planets and galaxies in their spaceships. But will the emitted cube probe meet the intended target? And will the fuel crystals be powerful enough to make the journey to the next planet? Only those who skilfully aim and roll the die in the dice and discovery game Space Planets will be able to score points in the end and collect the coveted explorer stars.

In A Bind Jr invites you to make funny poses and animal noises. Each card has an instruction, e.g., "one finger touching ear", "this card on a shoulder", or "whenever you draw, trumpet like an elephant". If you forget to do one of these instructions (or can't), you get a warning; three warnings and you lose the game. The goal is survival!

In A Bind Jr works like In A Bind+expansions, but with bright colors, simplified instructions, and some modified triggered binds. In addition to the default mode, there are also rules for team-based or co-operative play.

Focus On Your Karma Path And Collect Elemental Matches!

You can travel down life through good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Move Master, your best tactic is to collect that bad karma now and give it to your opponents to get the win.

This 3rd entry into the Karma Crystals game collection adds the use of elemental shards with move shards to gain movement and 12 new monster elemental cards for your collector’s deck!

Your mission is to gain as many moves forward down the karma path, collect elemental shards and be nice to other opponents so they don’t pass their Karma Crystals to you.

Roll dice to work with the various monster elemental cards - monsters are the good guys and help you win! Determine how many karma moves you score per roll and collect your karma move shards. Your move match also earns you an elemental shard, but if you get more of one type, you get to pass a Karma Crystal to another player. Your opponents also get Karma Crystals through a no-match roll, and you will get those too! When you get 11 or more karma moves, that triggers the end the game and the winner is determined at the end of that round!

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is also used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 20 minutes to play. No paper score cards and pencil needed - just move and elemental shards, and of course, Karma Crystals to track and build your score!

This game is actually a game collection. It hosts 4 games and 2 additional variants for one of them.

1.Yura Yura Balance Café
This is the main game the components can be played with. You have a stack of cards that represent coffee orders, several coffee “ingredients” and a playing area, which is a tablet on a dome shaped foot. The name part “balance” comes from the way it’s played. You draw a card from the deck which tells you, if you need to place a straight coffee, a coffee-to-go, a Milk Coffee or one of the 2 Macchiato versions on the tablet. There is a grid on said tablet to determine the places where you can, but on a coffee to go you can stack another coffee if you like. Whoever tips the tablet over loses. Besides the usual red cards, there are also green ones in the deck. These give you the opportunity to order somebody else to place the coffee (with a green cup), of course on their own risk.

2.Speed Order Café
This speed game needs at least 2 baristas and 1 customer. The customer shuffles the deck of cards and pulls 5 into her hand. She than reads them aloud to the baristas. After all 5 orders are read the customer gives the start sign, and all baristas start to assemble the coffees in order. Whoever is fastest stops the game. If she is correct on all coffees she wins, otherwise the win goes to the next most complete and errorless contender.

3.Black and Milk Reversi
This is just Othello played with the components of the game.

4.Coffee Cup Tower
This is a stacking game were 2 or more players (Variant A/B) are stacking Black Coffee cups and Coffee-To-Go’s as high as possible. The variants are differentiated by the footprint of the initial layer. First Player to tip the tower loses.
Ladybugs eat aphids, be the first player to roll the dice and eat 5,000 aphids for victory. Eat fast and win!

A game with multiple choice questions where you have to guess which answer someone else would give. A handheld electronic buzzer-object will tell you if the answer is correct or not. If answered correctly, you get to draw another card, and the first person to get ten correct answers is the winner.

So each turn, you draw a card and ask the question and answers on it (for example, "what would you take out of a burning house?" A my pet, B photo album, C diary or D hairgel and facial cream). The player to your left has one electronic object, you hold the other. Choose the letter that corresponds to the answer you think that person would give and hold the two objects together. If answered correctly, there should be a buzzing sound.

You get to know each other a little better, and the best "mind reader" wins.

Seems similar to The New Electronic Perfect Match Game, but without the board.

Dice Drivin' is a tiny racing game, with a track comprised of cards. To advance on the track, players throw customized dice, choosing (wisely) how many and which kind of dice as every track card has different requirements that must be met in order to advance. Players also have action cards to use at opportune times.

Set up a new track each time you play for new challenges!

Duel List is a competitive knowledge listing game in which players simultaneously list as many items in a topic as they can in 60 seconds on a piece of paper.

Gameplay: On a turn, the active player picks one of the 9 knowledge decks and rolls 2 dice.  1st die chooses category, 2nd die chooses specific topic.  Players have 60 seconds to list as many items as they can in that topic on a piece of paper.  Once the time is up, the active player starts to list out the items they wrote. Players list out their answers in clockwise order, scoring as needed. If any other player shared an answer, every player score 1 point for that answer.  Otherwise, the player receives 2 points for every valid, unique answer.

End of game: Once every player has had the chance to be the active player and choose a knowledge deck, then the game is over. Count up points, whoever has the most points wins.

Promotional mini game version of Carcassonne. Contained in the 999 games 25th anniversary box.

The game is only playable with two players and contains 20 smaller tiles and 8 smaller meeples in red and blue. The rules are the same as the original game excluding the farmer rule.

A summary of the rules is printed on the inside of the box. No score track is provided.

The tiles feature the new art style introduced in 2014.

Across Africa is a cooperative game for the young players that are just starting their adventure with board games. The game is designed for two to four players of age 6 and up.

During their African expedition the young players will discover new routes through the wilderness and take photos of the animals they encounter on the way. If they are lucky enough, they will meet one of the legendary diamond seekers and perhaps collect some precious jewels themselves.

The game consists of players turns, during which each of them rolls the dice and moves his pawn by the shown number of spaces on the board. The pawn may stop on one of the eight kinds of spaces. The player fulfills the action assigned to the type of the space. This may be for example making a photo of animals, moving backwards in the next turn, drawing an adventure card, collecting the diamond, meeting the snake and many more.

In order to win the game children have to fill up the whole crocodile shaped photo album with photos they took during their adventure and reach the last space on the board.

Across Africa offers also the alternate mode of playing. This time the players will not cooperate but race to the finish line, trying at the same time to collect as much diamonds and valuable photos as possible.

In Ciao! you want to say goodbye to the cards in your hand as quickly as possible.

Each player starts with a hand of seven cards; cards show either rock, paper or scissors, and they are colored either green, yellow or red. Some cards have special icons on them, such as play again or draw three cards. Cards are ranked in typical RPS order, but red beats yellow, which beats green.

On a turn, you play a card to the discard pile that beats the card showing on top, whether by playing paper on rock or by playing a higher ranked paper than what's already there. If you can't play, you draw one card, then play that card if possible.

The first player to empty their hand wins!

Magination is a game where you are in charge.

You can think of Magination as a deck of cards, where you can play a variety of different games. But unlike a deck of cards it’s much easier to be creative with the way you play. By experimenting with the pieces you will easily find fun and creative ways to enhance your gameplay. You can play games like magnetic golf, curling, air hockey or find new games never seen before. You can also use the magnets to build magtastic structures, either to use in games or to build new creations.

Magination will have an online community where the game can evolve. You will be able to find games, rate them and upload your own, and never run out of awesome ways to play. We know you guys will find more creative ways to use Magination than we ever could, which is why we’re handing the control to you. You vote on the best design for new pieces, making Magination completely user-driven. To make sure it grows into something personal for you, it will be possible to mix and match the pieces and colors of your choice, and easily expand the set you already own.

Quibble is a quiz game, where you have to name differnt numbers of items in a specific category. You get different point for different difficulty levels and also the time is different in these levels.

Each difficulty level is represented by a pile of card, worth 2, 4, 6, 8 or 10 points and on these cards is written how many items need to be named to win the points (e.g. you have to name 8 movies that won an Oscar).

The player can offer points to other players to get help and moves foward the won points on the scoreboard, when the needed number of items was named. First player to 42 points win the game.

Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Construction is the ultimate dungeon creator!  By using a unique random generation system you can create endless dungeon levels using the Dungeon Construction set.

Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Construction uses multiple variations of Rooms, Corridors, Corridor Room, and Junctions to help create a randomly generated dungeon level every time.

Each of these components contains different obstacles such as doors, treasure locations, random encounters, etc...   You build the level and then you explore using the second system - Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Adventure.

Dungeon Hack is a solo D&D game on a micro level using 4”x4” tile cards representing dungeon rooms, corridor rooms, corridors and junctions while colored cubes represent your characters and the ever increasing monsters.  A multitude of cards depict and define the monsters, treasures, encounters, and obstacles you will face within the dungeon.

From Technical Term Game Company.

This is a game based on the Victory Games Fleet System of tactical and operational naval warfare.

Individual named naval ships, airplane squadrons, and smaller coastal patrol combatants fight out a future 2nd Falklands War, Argentina vs Chile conflict, and other battles in the cold Southern seas.

Destiny Aurora: Renegades is a fast-paced, sci-fi adventure game that takes place both on the planet's surface and in orbit as the Renegades try to complete missions while attempting to be thwarted by the Coalition agents. Campaign-based miniatures game. Choose a ship, choose a crew, and choose a side.

Rauf und Runter is a roll-and-move board game with a meerkat theme on two layers with a few twists.

The player's meerkat pawns are magnetic and move therefore simultaneously on the top and bottom side of the gaming board.
Players start in the corners and must move their meerkat to a specific location, randomly revealed, and back to a corner. Roll the die and move accordingly one to three spaces to your destination. Borders (hedges, walls) may not be crossed. Then it's the move of the next player.

Once reaching a corner, however, the board is immediately turned upside down and play commences on this side. Players that did not reached their target space get a random one-shot-bonus of either moving two extra spaces, crossing a border, or taking a second move. The first player to visit all locations, then reach a corner wins.

Be sure not to lift your meerkat from the board while moving as this will cause the corresponding figure to fall off.

From the box:

The fun game of forward thinking and awareness!

Three characteristics... colour, symbol, size.

Place your tiles such that they match other tile(s) already on the table in at least one characteristic.  Simple?!  Sure it is.

But be extremely cautious with what tile(s) you place.  You may just be setting it all up beautifully for your opponent(s) to come in and out-think and out-score you.

Think a few steps ahead... and be aware - be very aware.

A fast paced game for 2-4 players.

Mecha 1945 is a tactical board game where you pilot big robots in a world war II alternate history.

It is a turn-based game, programming and simultaneous resolution. Each turn you can program movement, technic and combat order and resolved them on 91 hexagons board representing Manhattan.

The game is customizable with a lot of game modes, 9 board parts, around 190 cards to build your own mecha and a website with a 3D design module. The idea is that you can assemble the arms, legs, torsos, etc. so as to design the robot that suits you the most. You will have a 3D model that you can output with a 3D printer.

Depending the game mode you have choose you have to destroy foe Mecha, stay in the center of the map, capture flag, escort VIP,...

Play with you friends in teams or against them!

Égaru Idea to Market is a card game where you can learn the concepts of intellectual property and entrepreneurship.

The goal is to create projects starting with an Idea and ending in the Market, going through the different phases of the entrepreneurship process. To do this you must lay down cards in the correct order and possibly add booster cards to your own projects or attack cards to your opponents. A project requires between 3 and 6 phases to get to market - the more phases you get in the more points you will get.

Each player can have as many projects as he wants, but if a project is not closed with the Market card, it doesn’t count in the final score.

The player with the most points when there are no more cards to play is the winner.

From the box cover:

Grab your ghoul-friends for a fang-tastic game of truth or dare! On your turn, spin the spinner to see your fate...Spin Share and you'll reveal your spookiest secrets, monstrous crushes, and all the stuff that makes you eerily unique...try to guess each others' answers to score! Spin Scare and beware! You'll do one of a hundred challenges so fierce and funny they'll have you in stitches! It's a spook-a-rific race to get 13 points to win the game! Monster High Share or Scare-so fun, it's scary!

TXT Off (Text-Off) is a standard trivia game where players move around a board answering questions about texting language, shorthand and trivia. Categories may have all players answering or just the player whose turn it is. Players earn points by correctly answering questions. First player to 20 points wins.

PWNs is a unique game where you command your team of pawns to traverse a board filled with potentially-dangerous terrain to battle your way to victory.

Your team will use a combination of cards, abilities, and terrain to knock out enemy PWNs.

The object is to knock out just one team from the game. Then whichever team has the most remaining players with the most health points wins!

With so many possible combinations and variations randomly assigned at the beginning of the game, you'll never play the same game twice.

Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege is a game that utilizes WizKids Games' proprietary Dice Building Game platform in which two players take the role of warlords, collect and assemble their "party" of adventurer dice and battle in head-to-head gameplay.  Each turn, players roll the dice to see what resources they have available, buy dice, send their party members into the field, and then strike at the enemy warlord. There are multiple cards available for each type of die so players get to choose which one  to use. This lets players specialize dice to suit play style.

Additional cards and dice to expand your collection can be found in expansion packs. Each Foil Pack contains two cards and two dice that players can add to their Dice Masters Faerûn Under Siege collections. Players can create teams of their favorite fantasy characters from the Forgotten Realms universe.

The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters line will consist of starter sets, a Collector's Box, booster packs, play mats, and a "Party" storage box.

WING LEADER: Supremacy 1943-1945 is the second volume of GMT's exciting Wing Leader game series, which started with Wing Leader: Victories 1940-1942. WING LEADER allows you to play out large-scale aerial combats in World War II.

Based on a unique side-scrolling view, WING LEADER: Supremacy 1943-1945 lets you recreate the climactic air battles at the end of the war. Scenarios feature fights above the Reich, Normandy, Italy, Romania, the Eastern Front, and the Pacific. Players fly squadrons and flights, attempting to intercept raids or fend off marauding fighters in fast-playing games that take between 90 and 120 minutes. Rules cover late war armaments such as air-to-air rockets and jet aircraft.

WING LEADER: Supremacy 1943-1945 is a stand-alone game and features more aircraft, more squadrons, and more battles. When combined with its sister game, WING LEADER: Victories 1940-1942, this second volume now creates an experience that spans the entire war.

Travel through the galaxy as you buy, sell and trade organizations, factions and locations as depicted in the Mass Effect video game trilogy.

Includes:

     6 Collectible Tokens: N7 Helmet, Space Hamster, Normandy, Omni Tool, Shifty Looking Cow, and Mako
     Custom Game Board featuring Elites, Special Interests, Mercs, and Crews
     Custom Chance & Community Chest Cards

The Chu–Han Contention is updated and commercial edition of Chuhan War, a historical wargame of Chu–Han Contention from 206 B.C. to 202 B.C.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuâ€“Han_Contention
The game includes three short scenarios and one long scenario. Each player plays the role of Xiang Yu, Liu Bang or Han Xin (only in 3-player scenario).

No moderator, no elimination, five-minute games.

Blink of Death is a fast game for 4-12 players in which everyone gets a role: One of the Shifter Demons, the Abandoned, the helpful Anchorite, or one of a dozen different characters, each with a special ability. In 30 seconds, The Demon must kill one others or lose.

Because Blink of Death is so fast, fun, and engaging, you'll want to play it again and again, and no two games are ever the same.

A team of infiltrators from the triad penetrated the police force. However, the police also has sent a team of undercover agents to infiltrate the triad. Ten years later, they are still undercover, but their minds have been twisted by the temptation of power, authority and money — and nobody is certain about their original roles anymore. Both groups learn that they have been infiltrated and want to ferret out the moles. Each mole has a secret code to lock their identity file, and once the code is cracked their identity is fully revealed. The battle of wits starts now. Either exposing the enemy or taking the chance to change the identity for good can save their lives as long as nobody knows who is who!

Internal Affairs is an intense elimination game between infiltrators from both the Triad and the Police Force Infiltrator. Each player has a set of secret ID cards which determine that player's allegiance. Each player also has a secret code, which when cracked reveals the player's real ID. At the beginning of the game, each player has five code cards and chooses three of them to be the secret code that locks the identity file. During their turn, players try to crack other players' codes to find out who is who and get their team to victory. Due to action cards, though, ID cards may be passed from player to player and this may change each player's allegiance. Players must be quick to win, as otherwise they may end up in the losing team when they least expect it.

Internal Affairs is designed for 5-8 players, but alternative rules have been included to allow for play with 2-4.
